Class BaseValue

This class represents an immutable value object contains a number value and unit.

There are 2 types of units:

  1. PX: absolute value.
  2. PERCENTAGE: the percentage of parent value.

equals

  • equals(that: BaseValue): boolean
    • Defined in base/BaseValue.ts:121

    Checks whether two BaseValue objects are equal. The result is true if and only if the argument is a BaseValue object that has the same number value and unit as this Rect.

    Parameters

    • that: BaseValue

      the Object to compare with this BaseValue object.

    Returns boolean

    true if the objects are equal; false otherwise.

getValue

  • getValue(base: number): number
    • Defined in base/BaseValue.ts:65

    Calculate the absolute value by the arguments.

    Parameters

    • base: number

      the base value for percentage unit.

    Returns number

    current object's number value if the unit is absolute, or base * number / 100 for percentage unit.

Static of

  • of(value: string | number, silent?: boolean): BaseValue | undefined
    • Defined in base/BaseValue.ts:22

    Convert a string to a BaseValue object.

    Parameters

    • value: string | number

      if it is a string value and ends with '%', parse it as a percentage value, otherwise parse it as a absolute value.

    • Default value silent: boolean = false

    Returns BaseValue | undefined

    A BaseValue object for valid value, otherwise returns undefined.
